verbose_text: Interestingly, introduction of a plasmid (pTW134) carrying the cloned fepE gene from S. Paratyphi A into S. Typhi resulted in the expression of very long O antigen chains (XREF_SUPPLEMENTARY) and the binding of human IgM to the bacterial surface (XREF_SUPPLEMENTARY), suggesting that the Vi antigen cannot prevent the binding of IgM to very long LPS species.
evidence: expression of very long O antigen
